Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as d219fa3c481509e57c99fface2fa8001b579f923
Minor request to change error message text.
not needed in this file it doesn't look like

There is a whole lot of implicitly defined and undocumented JSON requirements here.  Please figure out a way to document it.  At least give a schema and/or example of what this code is expecting so someone doesn't have to reverse engineer your code to figure out how to program this thing.
I have explained the gpio config details in readme file
Why is the mux also a HostSelector?  Don't we already have a HostSelector?  I'm slightly surprised by this, but maybe that is appropriate.
phosphor-buttons interface class needs a dbus object associated with it. So I have used HostSelector's dbus object as it is relatable rather than introducing a new dbus interface.
Removed the dbus interface for this class.
Why does this end up being a uint8_t?  What does it represent?  The character from the GPIO buttons interface?  Please document.
This represents the index of debug card present GPIO config, which is part of the JSON GPIO configs along with the serial uart MUX select GPIOs,
instead of getting index from config, introduced name for each group gpio, so that the debug card present gpio is directly read from json config based on the name "debug_card_present".
What is the meaning of 'hs'?  This is not an intuitive name to me.  (I suspect "host selector" but let's be more explicit in naming).
What is this mapping?  Host positions to GPIO value?  Should this be a size_t to size_t?
Not sure why this was removed here.  "include what you use" is typical suggested behavior for includes and phosphor-logging is certainly used inside this file.

Please leverage:

include/sdbusplus/bus/match.hpp:inline auto propertiesChanged(const std::string& p, const std::string& i)
Just spell it out.  No sense in making it harder to read the code just to save 2 characters.
For consistency I prefer errno to be "ERRNO" and "ERROR" to be for exception text.  Check throughout.
This is very unintuitive if so.  Please make sure 1 = high unless you have a good reason otherwise.  If you need polarity in the JSON, add it.
Done .Introduced polarity in gpio config, as well as added getter and setter methods in gpio.cpp to modify gpio states.
These don't need to be captured by reference since they don't change.
Seems we have some polarity issue here too?
Please set up the map to avoid having to do string processing at runtime.  Do it once during init if you have to.
Raw casting of an enum to a uint8_t is potentially undefined behavior.  Can you improve this?
What is the purpose of these extra characters and the extra space at the beginning?
You could have multiple properties that changed in a single signal.  Please convert this to a loop.
I see no update to the readme file.
Sorry missed it in the last patch. Added the readme file
Are we missing a call to ButtonIFRegister somewhere?
It is added in the cpp file
Why do we have a path?
since the base class has the object path as constructor parameter, this is needed.
I don't understand the purpose in this variable.  Don't we save the button config?  Is it really useful to save a portion of it elsewhere?

The serial mux has 4 gpio configs.The debug card present gpio is additional config stored as 5th config in the serial uart mux config array.The serial uart mux lines are needs to me mentioned in ascending order in the config as the mux config map is stored as bit values. To parse only the serial uart mux gpios this variable is needed.
I'd prefer a clearer string here like "not-a-dbus-object" so that if it ends up being put somewhere it is more obvious.
Do you want map, unordered_map, or vector?

Have you tested this?  I don't know how you can put an empty string for interface.  Don't we have a dbus-interface that we're specifically looking for signals from?

`sdbusplus::xyz::openbmc_project::Chassis:Buttons::client::HostSelector::interface` maybe?
Should we move this to the constructor to make sure we're only doing this search once?
I really don't follow the complexity of putting this in a lambda and iterating over integers.  Why don't we have all this code in the for-loop on line 90 that iterates over `config.gpios` directly?
The serial uart mux lines are needs to me mentioned in ascending order in the config as the mux config map is stored as bit values.So iterating via numbers is needed here.
Why not compare with gpioConfig.name directly?
Would a ternary make this more obvious?

I will say that the use of 'high'/'low' and a 'polarity' make it less obvious to me in general.  It seems like we really have "asserted"/"deasserted" and a polarity that determines which direction is "asserted".
did you mean to change the enum GpioState::low/GpioState::high into GpioState::assert/GpioState::deassert.
Why are you forward declaring this?

I suspect this should be HostSelector::PropertiesVariant.  Otherwise you're going to later end up with a potential runtime failure if we ever add a new property to HostSelector.

PropertiesVariant is unfortunately only put on the server.hpp, so where I put ::client:: elsewhere you should probably switch to ::server::.
Looks like generally we use 'ERROR' and not 'EXCEPTION'.  Please keep it consistent.
Hi All, If possible could you review latest patch regarding the serial console mux
Please fix all the stray whitespace.

I still don't understand what is going on here.  Why aren't you using the `sdbusRule::propertiesChanged`?  You've left off the interface.  Don't you need to know the interface you're trying to accept signals from?

Since the dbus object path is provided the Hostinterface is not necessary . I have verified this logic and it is working i.e match handler is called upon property change. anyway When using the sdbusRule::propertiesChanged The final string is adding "arg0" at the end and with that even with or without mentioning the host selector interface, the match event handler is not invoked upon property change.So i have kept the logic as it is for now.

This assumes there is only one interface at that dbus path.  I don't think you're gaining anything by avoiding that part of the match-filter and, as you see, it makes it harder for someone to understand what you're trying to accomplish.

I would strongly prefer you put the appropriate interface in here and used `sdbusRule::propertiesChanged`.
Does the lambda actually make this code easier to read?  I'm not sure it does.  Should this just go into the for-loop?
nit: spelling.  Also, seems like this line should end in a period if it's a full sentence, and on the next line 'more' should be capitalized.
at least some markdown renderers will merge these all into a single line.  Not sure what github would do, but maybe safer to make these a bulleted list.
is there any danger of buttonCfg.gpios being empty so that gpioLineCount, which is isn't signed, gets set to 0 - 1?
Done. added the minimum possible config check

nit:  may as well just delete line 51 and have
auto debugCardpresent = isOC....

Also, I guess technically it should be camel case so debugCardPresent
